reviews.review_msg: The best prof EVER! Make us work hard but is all worth it. Super engaged in assisting students to get most of the experience. Her knowledge and commitment are very inspiring. Super appreciated the guess lectures.

Too much in class work and too much reading outside of class.  Sometimes you feel like there is no room to breathe and no time to think because there is just so much work.  She goes the full four hours with little time for breaks.  I was just exasperated.  It was like a war of attrition and really , a course should help you learn.  Gross.

A lot of work.  A lot of readings and you must never miss a class or she will likely begin to treat you different.  Teaches from a very critical perspective.  Could have been a great course, Diversity in Education, but  it was so demanding that it became difficult to learn and enjoy.  Used to getting A+'s in Education but I dropped significantly.

Pretty decent course. 5 online discussions worth 5% each. A 2,500 - 3,000 word term paper worth 20% on a topic of your choice. Mid-term was quite fair, two essay questions for 25%. However, the final was a curve ball. Nothing like what was expected. Consisted of 10 short essays and 1 long essay for 30% and was cumulative
Not recommended. Difficult, time consuming and boring. Take it if you want to spends hours on end ruining your GPA! Have fun :)

Ugh, took this course in Fall 2012 and it was HARD and TIME CONSUMING. I was really interested in the topic going in and walked out regretting it. I wanted an elective related to law and regret not taking CRIM 135 instead. Overall, extremely hard for an EDUC course and requires a LOT of time and effort for little reward

TOUGH COURSE!!! Do not take this course expecting it to be a GPA booster, in fact it will do the exact OPPOSITE. I took this out of pure interest but there are better options than EDUC 448. Never take this course because you've been warned!!
